Participation Assessment: Each member’s contributions to the project are evaluated

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"c11eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c51eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"c51eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"c51eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"cd1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"cd1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"cd1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"7d1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a9619c9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"PROJECT PROPOSAL","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

(Existing Assessment)
Students identify, research, and analyse the problems given in an initial project description.

They plan and specify a proposed solution to the identified problems, describe a product backlog of functionality to be delivered for the end product, as well as an initial sprint backlog to describe the functionality to be delivered in their first project iteration.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"c11eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c51eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"c51eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"cd1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"cd1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a96198e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8a1eeff4db975090eb6b147a3a9619d2","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Progressive Checkpoints","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"30","description":"

A number of check-points allow students to iteratively assess their project progress, and work processes over the course of the term: through demonstrations/presentation of completed work; and through the use of agile retrospectives to iteratively work on improving their skills and strategies for working effectively in a team.

contentlets.description: A capstone software project. Students work in teams to define, implement and evaluate a real-world software system. Most of the work in this course is team-based project work, although there are some introductory lectures on software project management and teamwork strategies. Project teams meet weekly with project mentors to report on the progress of the project. Assessment is based on a project proposal, progressive demonstrations and retrospectives, a final project demonstration and report, and on the quality of the software system itself. Students are also required to reflect on their work and to provide peer assessment of their team-mates' contributions to the project.

Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the first of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the term the student should have researched the problem, identified current approaches, developed a plan to complete the project, and carried out some of that plan. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 9 of the term.


Enrolment is subject to meeting the following criteria:


  • completed (or have advanced standing in) 66 UOC; and
  • obtained agreement from a CSE academic supervisor; and
  • maintained a distinction level performance in the program

Note: students who take COMP9991 must also take COMP9992 or COMP9993. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.

\n

The seminar will be attended by (at least) the supervisor and one other member of academic staff, who will provide feedback on the progress and plan, and determine whether COMP9992 or COMP9993 would be appropriate in the following term.

contentlets.description:
Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the first of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the term the student should have researched the problem, identified current approaches, developed a plan to complete the project, and carried out some of that plan. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 9 of the term.

Enrolment is subject to meeting the following criteria:

  • completed (or have advanced standing in) 66 UOC; and
  • obtained agreement from a CSE academic supervisor; and
  • maintained a distinction level performance in the program

Note: students who take COMP9991 must also take COMP9992 or COMP9993. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.

Research Project B","description":"

Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the second of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the second term, the student should have carried out the research work and produced some results. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 10 of the term and via a written report.


Note: students who take COMP9992 must also take COMP9991 first. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"9605cbf2db1f5010358b403c3a96192f","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Second Term Seminar","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

Students must present a seminar in Week 10 giving a review of the results of the project

The seminar will be attended by (at least) the supervisor and one other member of academic staff.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1605cbf2db1f5010358b403c3a961932","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"d605cbf2db1f5010358b403c3a961931","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6205cbf2db1f5010358b403c3a9619eb","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final Report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"75","description":"

Students must submit a final report containing: an overview of the problem, literature review, results achieved, conclusions and limitations.

The report will be assessed independently by the supervisor and assessor.

The report should represent the results of around 300 hours work.

contentlets.description:
Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the second of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the second term, the student should have carried out the research work and produced some results. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 10 of the term and via a written report.

Note: students who take COMP9992 must also take COMP9991 first. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.

Research Project C","description":"

Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the second of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the second term, the student should have carried out the research work and produced some results. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 10 of the term and via a written report.


Note: students who take COMP9993 must also take COMP9991 first. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5df58b36db1f5010358b403c3a9619e8","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Second Term Seminar","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

Students must present a seminar in Week 10 giving a review of the results of the project.

The seminar will be attended by (at least) the supervisor and one other member of academic staff.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"51f58b36db1f5010358b403c3a9619eb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"59f58b36db1f5010358b403c3a9619ea","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9df58b36db1f5010358b403c3a9619ed","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final Report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"75","description":"

Students must submit a final report containing: an overview of the problem, literature review, results achieved, conclusions and limitations.

The report will be assessed independently by the supervisor and assessor.

The report should represent the results of around 450 hours work.

A Thesis C project should have more depth and more substantial results than a Thesis B project.

contentlets.description:
Students in their final terms of study in MIT (8543) have the option of replacing some coursework with a research project, carried out under the supervision of a CSE academic staff member. This forms the second of a two-part sequence of courses. By the end of the second term, the student should have carried out the research work and produced some results. The student must demonstrate this in a formal seminar presented in week 10 of the term and via a written report.

Note: students who take COMP9993 must also take COMP9991 first. They do not take COMP9900 Information Technology Project.
